mods.abstract: NEGRO-BOY IN JAIL. WAS committed into the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 11th inst., a negro-boy, calling himself BEN, and saying he belongs to Mr. E. Ogden, residing in the Parish of Avoyelles. This boy is about 40 years old, five feet, five inches high, having a long cut on the right jaw extending as far as the eye, speaks but english, is very black and has a long beard. The owner is requested to come forward prove property, pay charges and take him away, otherwise he will be dealt with according to law. LOUIS L. BOUTTE, Jailor. Opelousas, July 15th, 1854.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
